DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to use a novel load monitoring technology to correlate limb loading to ankle fracture outcomes. This study will collect continuous limb loading data and will provide the first objective insight into how limb loading directs fracture healing.
DOC.brief_title: Insole Sensor to Determine Optimal Limb Loading in the Rehabilitation of Ankle Fractures
DOC.criteria: Patient is 18 years of age or older Patient has an ankle fracture Patient speaks English Patient weighs between 100 and 250 pounds Patient lives in close enough proximity to the hospital to return for all appointments (~100 miles) Patient is younger than 18 years of age Patient has multiple fractures that would alter weight bearing protocol Patient does not speak English Patient weighs less than 100 pounds or more than 250 pounds Patient does not live in close enough proximity to the hospital to return for all appointments (~>100 miles) Patient has a traumatic brain injury that would make it so they cannot consent Patient has diabetes
